result.execSummary:
The defendant Demetric L. Battle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Demetric L. Battle is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Demetric L. Battle was found guilty of Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>1-5g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense, Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)1r.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
**  Pay fine of $1000.00  and court costs including all applicable surcharges.  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).
** Pay DNA surcharge.    Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May Not have contact with known felons - including relatives.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

timeConds.notes: TO COMMENCE FORTHWITH.  Huber - work crew allowed.  Unless work crew is expressly prohibited by the Court, an inmate serving time as a condition of probation is eligible for work crew and may receive a credit of one day for every 3 days of work performed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney C Lassiter.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 3 years w/conditions; 6 months conditional jail w/Huber-work crew privileges; deft taken into custody from court; $1,000 fine plus costs, submit DNA sample and pay $250 DNA surcharge; bond applied, any remainder of bond to be returned to poster; credit for 1 day served if revoked.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney C Lassiter.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, ct 2 is dismissed.  Deft pleads no contest.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI ordered.  SEH 1/26/15 at 1:30pm.  Bond continued.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney C Lassiter.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  For reasons set forth on the record, FPT continued to 11/24/14 at 9:30am.  Bond continued.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.
